any plant of the genus (= family of related plants) Fritillaria, with bell-shaped flowers that hang down: You can tell a lot about somebody by the kind of fritillaria they go for. Most fritillaria need plenty of moisture in the spring. Scarlet lily beetles attack all sorts of plants, notably fritillarias.
More examplesFewer examplesLilies, fritillaria, and galtonia are easy to raise from seed but need a spot to grow undisturbed. The crown imperials are the most dramatic and stately of the fritillaria family.For many gardeners, "snake's head" is not only the loveliest fritillaria, but the most striking of all spring bulbs.
